column4: i just insterted an sd card on my system and it's showing up in /media/usbdisk/ but using that for the of= parameter of dd doesn't work. how can use dd to write an image of an sd card onto my /media/usbdisk ???
you need to dd of= to the device, not where it's mounted
also, I wouldn't have the device mounted while you do that
i've unmounted the usbdisk, but how do i figure out what the device is called to dd to it?
easiest to just mount it, then 'mount'
certainly could be - just be sure you don't inadvertently clobber some other file system
best way to check is dd if=/dev/sde | od -c | less
that puts a bunch of trash i don't understand on my screen? heh
but drying a 'dd if=sd.dd of=/dev/sde' returns 'dd: opening '/dev/sde': Permission denied
best way to check is 'sudo dd if=/dev/sde | od -c | less
what should i expect out of that?
now remove the drive & see if the command still works ;)
i've re-inserted the card, and unmounted it again. what parameter should i pass to of= to hit sde?
attempting "dd if=sd.dd of=/dev/sde" or /dev/sde1 both return "dd: opening '/dev/sde': Permission denied
